mods.abstract: $200 Reward. RUNAWAY from the subscriber, on the 30th of November, 1858, a negro man named SEABOURN, about 23 years of age, 5 feet 2 inches high, black complexion, heavy built, has a sulkey look, a scollop in his right ear, and a small black spot in one ye. I will pay a reward of $50 for the recovery of said negro; or, as it is probably that he has been stolen, I will give $200 for his return and the arrest and conviction of the thief. JOHN WHALY. Columbia county, Ark., February 9, 1859-2t Any communications in relation to said boy may be directed to Haynesville, Louisiana.
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
